content.description: Suppose that the function f has a continuous second derivative for all x, and that f(0) = 2, f'(0) = -3,and f''(0) = 0. Let g be a function whose derivative is given by g'(x) = e-2x (3f(x) + 2f'(x)) for all x.
content.question: Is there sufficient information to determine whether or not the graph of f has a point of inflection when x = 0? Explain your answer.

frqParts.text: Is there sufficient information to determine whether or not the graph of f has a point of inflection when x = 0? Explain your answer.

topic.text: 5.6: Determining Concavity of Functions over Their Domains

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Describe the relationships among different representations of functions and their derivatives.
